title: On the Theory of Relativity
content: The theory of relativity arose from necessity, from serious and deep contradictions in the old theory from which there seemed no escape. The strength of the new theory lies in the consistency and simplicity with which it solves all these difficulties.

title: On Curiosity and Wonder
content: The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing. One cannot help but be in awe when he contemplates the mysteries of eternity, of life, of the marvelous structure of reality.

title: Imagination Over Knowledge
content: Imagination is more important than knowledge. For knowledge is limited, whereas imagination embraces the entire world, stimulating progress, giving birth to evolution.

title: God Does Not Play Dice
content: God does not play dice with the universe. The theory yields much, but it hardly brings us closer to the secret of the Old One. In any case, I am convinced that He does not play dice.

title: Space and Time Unity
content: Space and time are not conditions in which we live, but modes by which we think. Physical concepts are free creations of the human mind, and are not, however it may seem, uniquely determined by the external world.

title: Science and Religion
content: Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind. A person who is religiously enlightened appears to me to be one who has, to the best of his ability, liberated himself from the fetters of his selfish desires.

title: The Comprehensible Universe
content: The most incomprehensible thing about the universe is that it is comprehensible. The fact that it is comprehensible is a miracle.

title: On Atomic Energy and Responsibility
content: A new type of thinking is essential if mankind is to survive and move toward higher levels. The unleashed power of the atom has changed everything save our modes of thinking.

title: On Education and Learning
content: Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school. The important thing is to not stop questioning. Never lose a holy curiosity.

title: On Peace and Humanity
content: Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding. Nothing will end war unless the people themselves refuse to go to war.

title: Ethics and Scientific Progress
content: Concern for man himself and his fate must always form the chief interest of all technical endeavors. Never forget this in the midst of your diagrams and equations.

title: The Mystery of Existence
content: The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and science. He to whom this emotion is a stranger is as good as dead.

title: On Truth and Discovery
content: Truth is what stands the test of experience. The search for truth is more precious than its possession. We cannot solve our problems with the same thinking we used when we created them.

title: On Simplicity in Science
content: Everything should be made as simple as possible, but not simpler. The grand aim of all science is to cover the greatest number of empirical facts by logical deduction from the smallest number of hypotheses.

title: The Human Spirit in Science
content: The human spirit must prevail over technology. A man should look for what is, and not for what he thinks should be. The value of a man should be seen in what he gives and not in what he is able to receive.
